intro: Nauclea superba, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya, Tanzania, and South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and can grow as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its bark and leaves have been traditionally used in herbal medicine for their purported medicinal properties.
